ALGEBRA_FUNCTIONS.name: Algebra & Functions (EE/F)
ALGEBRA_FUNCTIONS.description: From variables and exponents to systems of equations.

NUMBER_SYSTEM.name: The Number System (NS)
NUMBER_SYSTEM.description: From fraction division to irrational numbers.

RATIOS_PROPORTIONS.name: Ratios & Proportionality (RP)
RATIOS_PROPORTIONS.description: From unit rates to slope and percent.

GEOMETRY.name: Geometry (G)
GEOMETRY.description: From area and circles to transformations.

8.EE.C.8.description: Analyze and solve pairs of simultaneous linear equations (Systems).

8.F.B.4.description: Construct a function to model a linear relationship (y=mx+b).

8.EE.C.7.description: Solve linear equations in one variable with one, zero, or infinite solutions.

8.EE.A.1.description: Know and apply the properties of integer exponents.

7.EE.B.4a.description: Solve word problems leading to equations of the form px + q = r.

7.EE.B.4b.description: Solve word problems leading to inequalities (px + q > r).

6.EE.B.7.description: Solve real-world problems by writing equations of the form x + p = q.

6.EE.A.2.description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

6.EE.B.8.description: Write an inequality to represent a constraint in a real-world problem.

6.EE.A.1.description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.

8.NS.A.1.description: Know that numbers that are not rational are called irrational.

7.NS.A.1.description: Apply properties of operations to add and subtract rational numbers (Integers).

7.NS.A.2.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication and division of rational numbers.

6.NS.C.6.description: Understand a rational number as a point on the number line.

6.NS.B.3.description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, and divide multi-digit decimals.

6.NS.B.4.description: Find the greatest common factor and the least common multiple.

6.NS.A.1.description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions.

8.EE.B.5.description: Graph proportional relationships, interpreting the unit rate as the slope.

7.RP.A.2.description: Recognize and represent proportional relationships between quantities.

7.RP.A.3.description: Use proportional relationships to solve multistep ratio and percent problems.

6.RP.A.3.description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems.

8.G.B.7.description: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to determine unknown side lengths.

8.G.A.3.description: Describe the effect of dilations, translations, rotations, and reflections on 2D figures.

8.G.C.9.description: Know the formulas for the volumes of cones, cylinders, and spheres.

7.G.B.4.description: Know the formulas for the area and circumference of a circle.

7.G.B.6.description: Solve real-world problems involving area, volume and surface area.

6.G.A.1.description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, and polygons.

8.EE.A.2.description: Use square root and cube root symbols to represent solutions to equations.

8.SP.A.1.description: Construct and interpret scatter plots for bivariate measurement data.

7.SP.C.7.description: Develop a probability model and use it to find probabilities of events.

7.SP.A.1.description: Understand statistics can be used to gain information about a population by examining a sample.

6.SP.B.5.description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context (Mean, Median, MAD).
